column2: Counsel  for  the  Appellant submitted that the  objection to  the jurisdiction
was not taken at the earliest opportunity and therefore it is too late to raise
in  the  appeal.  This  is  an  incorrect  submission.  The  2nd  Respondent  in
paragraph (x)  of his  affidavit dated  12th  May  2003  stated that there  is  no
breach of the peace has taken place.  In the proceedings under section 66,
no  issues  were  raised.  The  Primary  Court  Judge  is  expected to  consider

column6: information  filed  by  an  interesting  party

column2: under section 66(1)(b),  and the alleged threat to the breach of the peace is

column1: cautiously  and  ascertain  for  himself whether there  is  a  dispute  affecting

column2: land threatening the breach of the peace or likely.  Failure to do so vitiates
